etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin, from a variant of Greek sturax

definitions: a rare fragrant gum resin obtained from an eastern Mediterranean tree, sometimes used in medicine, perfumery, and incense.
shortDefinitions: rare fragrant gum resin obtained from East Mediterranean tree

definitions: a liquid balsam obtained from the Asian liquidambar tree.
shortDefinitions: liquid balsam obtained from Asian liquidambar tree

definitions: a tropical or subtropical tree or shrub with showy white flowers in drooping clusters.

notes.text: Genus Styrax, family Styracaceae: several species, in particular S. officinalis, from which the resin storax is obtained

shortDefinitions: tropical or subtropical tree or shrub with showy white flowers in drooping clusters
